Review: Good adaptation. Visually stunning. I still prefer the 1930 version.

MST3K version: Looking back on my past ratings, I'm not sure how I settled on the same score for this and John Ford’s Young Mr. Lincoln, but here we are. Ann-Margret and John Forsythe both do a fine job in their respective roles. There's some genuine suspense, and Forsythe's character seems to always make the wrong decision and dig himself into a progressively deeper hole, which just adds to the fun.

Stumbled upon this short while down a Wikipedia rabbit hole, and it turned out to be a fascinating watch. Just a few months after his explosive directing debut, The Maltese Falcon, Hollywood legend John Huston lent his talents to the war effort.Two relatives of mine served in the Army Air Forces in World War II, including one cousin killed during Operation Market Garden in 1944. From today's perspective, it's mind-boggling how Uncle Sam convinced them, along with hundreds of…

Movie: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Tenacious D in The Pick of Destiny

Review: Surely a better filmmaker could’ve depicted the horrors of witch-hunting while also exercising some measure of restraint…imagine how The Wicker Man would be diminished if it featured extended scenes of Edward Woodward screaming bloody murder while being tortured and burned to death. Worth watching to see Price and Robert Russells’ great performances as a duo of truly despicable villains but not for much else.

I've always found Jimmy Stewart's performances a bit too hokey to really enjoy, so it's pretty cool to see his character descend into obsessed madness. In part because of the film's trippiness at times – and maybe also because of the unbelievable age difference between Stewart and Novak – the interpretation that it's a contemporary take on "An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge" makes the viewing, for me, a bit more satisfying.

Movie: The Sons of Sam: A Descent Into Darkness

Review: The summer after my freshman year in high school, my grandfather passed away suddenly. I've never been able to forgive myself for rushing him off the phone a few weeks before in what ended up being the last time we spoke.

Movie: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

Review: This was on my watchlist from the time it premiered at Sundance, and I finally got to see it 2.5 years later. Worth the wait. Often the best documentaries are the ones where the filmmakers go in expecting to capture one thing and end up seeing something else entirely. Here, the crew were embedded on former-Congressman Weiner's mayoral campaign from its early days and were poised to document the political comeback/redemption of the deeply flawed guy we all know. Instead, they played witness to him completely going down in flames.
